channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Multi-view Tensor Graph Neural Networks Through Reinforced Aggregation
item.description: Specifically, RTGNN first uses tensor decomposition to extract the graph structure features (GSFs) of each view in the common feature space.

item.title: WavCaps: A ChatGPT-Assisted Weakly-Labelled Audio Captioning Dataset for Audio-Language Multimodal Research
item.description: To address this data scarcity issue, we introduce WavCaps, the first large-scale weakly-labelled audio captioning dataset, comprising approximately 400k audio clips with paired captions.

item.title: Elastic Weight Removal for Faithful and Abstractive Dialogue Generation
item.description: We evaluate our method -- using different variants of Flan-T5 as a backbone language model -- on multiple datasets for information-seeking dialogue generation and compare our method with state-of-the-art techniques for faithfulness, such as CTRL, Quark, DExperts, and Noisy Channel reranking.

item.title: Forget-Me-Not: Learning to Forget in Text-to-Image Diffusion Models
item.description: The unlearning problem of deep learning models, once primarily an academic concern, has become a prevalent issue in the industry.

item.title: Mole Recruitment: Poisoning of Image Classifiers via Selective Batch Sampling
item.description: In this work, we present a data poisoning attack that confounds machine learning models without any manipulation of the image or label.

item.title: Rethinking the Approximation Error in 3D Surface Fitting for Point Cloud Normal Estimation
item.description: Most existing approaches for point cloud normal estimation aim to locally fit a geometric surface and calculate the normal from the fitted surface.

item.title: An evaluation framework for comparing epidemic intelligence systems
item.description: In the context of Epidemic Intelligence, many Event-Based Surveillance (EBS) systems have been proposed in the literature to promote the early identification and characterization of potential health threats from online sources of any nature.

item.title: Invertible Convolution with Symmetric Paddings
item.description: We show that symmetrically padded convolution can be analytically inverted via DFT.

item.title: PAIR-Diffusion: Object-Level Image Editing with Structure-and-Appearance Paired Diffusion Models
item.description: Nevertheless, most of them lack fine-grained control over the properties of the different objects present in the image, i. e. object-level image editing.

item.title: CodeGeeX: A Pre-Trained Model for Code Generation with Multilingual Evaluations on HumanEval-X
item.description: Large pre-trained code generation models, such as OpenAI Codex, can generate syntax- and function-correct code, making the coding of programmers more productive and our pursuit of artificial general intelligence closer.

item.title: PoseFormerV2: Exploring Frequency Domain for Efficient and Robust 3D Human Pose Estimation
item.description: However, in real scenarios, the performance of PoseFormer and its follow-ups is limited by two factors: (a) The length of the input joint sequence; (b) The quality of 2D joint detection.

item.title: Sasaki Metric for Spline Models of Manifold-Valued Trajectories
item.description: We propose a generic spatiotemporal framework to analyze manifold-valued measurements, which allows for employing an intrinsic and computationally efficient Riemannian hierarchical model.

item.title: Robo3D: Towards Robust and Reliable 3D Perception against Corruptions
item.description: The robustness of 3D perception systems under natural corruptions from environments and sensors is pivotal for safety-critical applications.

item.title: NeRF-Supervised Deep Stereo
item.description: We introduce a novel framework for training deep stereo networks effortlessly and without any ground-truth.

item.title: HuggingGPT: Solving AI Tasks with ChatGPT and its Friends in HuggingFace
item.description: Solving complicated AI tasks with different domains and modalities is a key step toward artificial general intelligence (AGI).

item.title: Whose Opinions Do Language Models Reflect?
item.description: Language models (LMs) are increasingly being used in open-ended contexts, where the opinions reflected by LMs in response to subjective queries can have a profound impact, both on user satisfaction, as well as shaping the views of society at large.

item.title: Assessing Cross-Cultural Alignment between ChatGPT and Human Societies: An Empirical Study
item.description: The recent release of ChatGPT has garnered widespread recognition for its exceptional ability to generate human-like responses in dialogue.

item.title: Token Merging for Fast Stable Diffusion
item.description: In the process, we speed up image generation by up to 2x and reduce memory consumption by up to 5. 6x.

item.title: Masked Autoencoders as Image Processors
item.description: Recently, masked autoencoders (MAE) for feature pre-training have further unleashed the potential of Transformers, leading to state-of-the-art performances on various high-level vision tasks.

item.title: LayoutDiffusion: Controllable Diffusion Model for Layout-to-image Generation
item.description: To overcome the difficult multimodal fusion of image and layout, we propose to construct a structural image patch with region information and transform the patched image into a special layout to fuse with the normal layout in a unified form.

item.title: Zero-Shot Video Editing Using Off-The-Shelf Image Diffusion Models
item.description: Our vid2vid-zero leverages off-the-shelf image diffusion models, and doesn't require training on any video.

item.title: 3D Line Mapping Revisited
item.description: In contrast to sparse keypoints, a handful of line segments can concisely encode the high-level scene layout, as they often delineate the main structural elements.

item.title: Streaming Video Model
item.description: We believe that the concept of streaming video model and the implementation of S-ViT are solid steps towards a unified deep learning architecture for video understanding.

item.title: Adversarial Attack and Defense for Dehazing Networks
item.description: In this paper, we focus on designing a group of attack methods based on first order gradient to verify the robustness of the existing dehazing algorithms.

item.title: Efficient distributed representations beyond negative sampling
item.description: Our contribution is to show that the sotfmax normalization constants can be estimated in linear time, allowing us to design an efficient optimization strategy to learn distributed representations.

item.title: Dynamic Conceptional Contrastive Learning for Generalized Category Discovery
item.description: This leads traditional novel category discovery (NCD) methods to be incapacitated for GCD, due to their assumption of unlabeled data are only from novel categories.

item.title: Complementary Random Masking for RGB-Thermal Semantic Segmentation
item.description: Also, the proposed self-distillation loss encourages the network to extract complementary and meaningful representations from a single modality or complementary masked modalities.

item.title: DERA: Enhancing Large Language Model Completions with Dialog-Enabled Resolving Agents
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) have emerged as valuable tools for many natural language understanding tasks.

item.title: OpenMix: Exploring Outlier Samples for Misclassification Detection
item.description: Reliable confidence estimation for deep neural classifiers is a challenging yet fundamental requirement in high-stakes applications.

item.title: Masked and Adaptive Transformer for Exemplar Based Image Translation
item.description: To overcome this challenge, we improve the accuracy of matching on the one hand, and diminish the role of matching in image generation on the other hand.

item.title: Neglected Free Lunch -- Learning Image Classifiers Using Annotation Byproducts
item.description: We refer to the new paradigm of training models with annotation byproducts as learning using annotation byproducts (LUAB).

item.title: ImageNet-E: Benchmarking Neural Network Robustness via Attribute Editing
item.description: We also evaluate some robust models including both adversarially trained models and other robust trained models and find that some models show worse robustness against attribute changes than vanilla models.

item.title: Shapley Chains: Extending Shapley Values to Classifier Chains
item.description: Compared to existing methods, this approach allows to attribute a more complete feature contribution to the predictions of multi-output classification tasks.

item.title: Recognition, recall, and retention of few-shot memories in large language models
item.description: In recognition experiments, we ask if the model can distinguish the seen example from a novel example; in recall experiments, we ask if the model can correctly recall the seen example when cued by a part of it; and in retention experiments, we periodically probe the model's memory for the original examples as the model is trained continuously with new examples.

item.title: Beyond Appearance: a Semantic Controllable Self-Supervised Learning Framework for Human-Centric Visual Tasks
item.description: Unlike the existing self-supervised learning methods, prior knowledge from human images is utilized in SOLIDER to build pseudo semantic labels and import more semantic information into the learned representation.

item.title: Text revision in Scientific Writing Assistance: An Overview
item.description: Writing a scientific article is a challenging task as it is a highly codified genre.

item.title: Evaluating GPT-3.5 and GPT-4 Models on Brazilian University Admission Exams
item.description: The present study aims to explore the capabilities of Language Models (LMs) in tackling high-stakes multiple-choice tests, represented here by the Exame Nacional do Ensino M\'edio (ENEM), a multidisciplinary entrance examination widely adopted by Brazilian universities.

item.title: ViewRefer: Grasp the Multi-view Knowledge for 3D Visual Grounding with GPT and Prototype Guidance
item.description: In this paper, we propose ViewRefer, a multi-view framework for 3D visual grounding exploring how to grasp the view knowledge from both text and 3D modalities.

item.title: Cascaded Local Implicit Transformer for Arbitrary-Scale Super-Resolution
item.description: Implicit neural representation has recently shown a promising ability in representing images with arbitrary resolutions.

item.title: Multimodal Image-Text Matching Improves Retrieval-based Chest X-Ray Report Generation
item.description: In this work, we propose Contrastive X-Ray REport Match (X-REM), a novel retrieval-based radiology report generation module that uses an image-text matching score to measure the similarity of a chest X-ray image and radiology report for report retrieval.

item.title: Seeing What You Said: Talking Face Generation Guided by a Lip Reading Expert
item.description: To address the problem, we propose using a lip-reading expert to improve the intelligibility of the generated lip regions by penalizing the incorrect generation results.

item.title: HybridPoint: Point Cloud Registration Based on Hybrid Point Sampling and Matching
item.description: Firstly, we propose to use salient points with prominent local features as nodes to increase patch repeatability, and introduce some uniformly distributed points to complete the point cloud, thus constituting hybrid points.

item.title: DPF: Learning Dense Prediction Fields with Weak Supervision
item.description: We showcase the effectiveness of DPFs using two substantially different tasks: high-level semantic parsing and low-level intrinsic image decomposition.

item.title: Are Neural Architecture Search Benchmarks Well Designed? A Deeper Look Into Operation Importance
item.description: We found that only a subset of the operation pool is required to generate architectures close to the upper-bound of the performance range.

item.title: GAT-COBO: Cost-Sensitive Graph Neural Network for Telecom Fraud Detection
item.description: Extensive experiments on two real-world telecom fraud detection datasets demonstrate that our proposed method is effective for the graph imbalance problem, outperforming the state-of-the-art GNNs and GNN-based fraud detectors.

item.title: Latent Feature Relation Consistency for Adversarial Robustness
item.description: Deep neural networks have been applied in many computer vision tasks and achieved state-of-the-art performance.

item.title: BEVSimDet: Simulated Multi-modal Distillation in Bird's-Eye View for Multi-view 3D Object Detection
item.description: In this paper, we approach this challenge from the perspective of both architecture design and knowledge distillation and present a new simulated multi-modal 3D object detection method named BEVSimDet.

item.title: Ten Quick Tips for Harnessing the Power of ChatGPT/GPT-4 in Computational Biology
item.description: The rise of advanced chatbots, such as ChatGPT, has sparked curiosity in the scientific community.

item.title: DORT: Modeling Dynamic Objects in Recurrent for Multi-Camera 3D Object Detection and Tracking
item.description: Recent multi-camera 3D object detectors usually leverage temporal information to construct multi-view stereo that alleviates the ill-posed depth estimation.

item.title: LMDA-Net:A lightweight multi-dimensional attention network for general EEG-based brain-computer interface paradigms and interpretability
item.description: By incorporating two novel attention modules designed specifically for EEG signals, the channel attention module and the depth attention module, LMDA-Net can effectively integrate features from multiple dimensions, resulting in improved classification performance across various BCI tasks.
